title: What is the difference between technology management and operation management? - Quora

response.answer_text: This question is better answered by example. Technology management example, managing 100 laptops in your company when to receive windows update. Try google KB4512941, and you will understand why people frustated with this particular windows update. Operation management usually fall under HSE, which is much wider then computing in context. E.g. when you want to cross the street, follow zebra cross. This is particularly enforced inside a manufacturing / plant zones. In IT, the closest fall under security context : No personal laptop is allowed to access corporate servers. Use company’s provided laptop. Conclusion : As you can see technology management has clear context on which technology to manage. Technology management goes by brand : SAP, microsoft, vmware, etc..etc… Anything outside that, usually fall under general umbrella operation management.

Operations management encompasses all of the functions required to get your product to market. Every department contributes to operations. Technology management applies to the development and management of technology to keep a company competitive in the marketplace. This is a more specialized department.
